text.0: thou art the king of all the gods o indra protect the men o asura preserve us.
text.1: thou lord of heroes maghavan our saver art faithful very rich the victorygiver.
text.2: indra thou humbledst tribes that spake with insult by breaking down seven autumn forts their refuge.
text.3: thou stirredst blameless billowy floods and gavest his foe a prey to youthful purukutsa.
text.4: with whom thou drivest troops whose lords are heroes and bringest daylight now much worshipped indra.
text.5: with them guard lionlike wasting active agni to dwell in our tilled fields and in our homestead.
text.6: they through the greatness of thy spear o indra shall to thy praise rest in this earthly station.
text.7: to loose the floods to seek for kine the battle his bays he mounted boldly seized the booty.
text.8: indra bear kutsa him in whom thou joyest the darkred horses of the wind are docile.
text.9: let the sun roll his chariot wheel anear us and let the thunderer go to meet the foemen.
text.10: thou indra lord of bays made strong by impulse hast slain the vexers of thy friends who give not.
text.11: they who beheld the friend beside the living were cast aside by thee as they rode onward.
text.12: indra the bard sang forth in inspiration thou madest earth a covering for the dāsa.
text.13: maghavan made the three that gleam with moisture and to his home brought kuyavāc to slay him.
text.14: these thine old deeds new bards have sung o indra thou conqueredst boundest many tribes for ever.
text.15: like castles thou hast crushed the godless races and bowed the godless scorners deadly weapon.
text.16: a stormer thou hast made the stormy waters flow down o indra like the running rivers.
text.17: when oer the flood thou broughtest them o hero thou keptest turvaśa and yadu safely.
text.18: indra mayst thou be ours in all occasions protector of the men most gentlehearted.
text.19: giving us victory over all our rivals may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
